roleset.name: bless, act of saying prayer, bestowing happiness/wellbeing
roleset.note: BLESS-V NOTES: This verb doesn't fit easily into this class; arg2 is usually a role(applaud as or for) and the fact that the gift can only occur with apassivized verb is suspicious also. Perhaps the class needs to besplit, or the membership reevaluated. (from bless.01-v)
BLESSING-N NOTES: Roleset based on BOLT P01 instances. Comparison to verb entry bless.01, which maps to VN class 33. FrameNet Rite. (from blessing.01-n)

example.name: straight transitive
example.text: [Jaguar shareholders]-2 would have *trace*-2 to bless such a far-reaching accord.

example.name: unstated blesser
example.text: I have seen one or two men die, *trace* bless them.

example.name: with gift
example.text: Though [I've]-1 been blessed *trace*-1 with academic degrees and some success in the materialistic world, I've never forgotten or lost contact with those memories of the 1930s.
example.arg: with academic degrees and some success in the materialistic world

example.name: predicative gift
example.text: To Mr. Engelken, it is also a story ``about love, because I'm blessed to have a wife who still thinks her slightly eccentric husband's 50th birthday deserves the ultimate present.''
example.arg: to have a wife who still thinks her slightly eccentric husband's 50th birthday deserves the ultimate present

example.name: All args
example.text: Christ's esteem for the natural institution of marriage is evident in His blessing of the wedding at Cana with a miracle.
